00009 /**
00010 * @brief Reads a line from the stream  ReadingFile keeping track which line reads. 
00011 * @return The read string. Throws string exception.
00012 */
00013 String^ SpinachGUI::IOSpinSystem::ReadLine()
00014 {
00015         String ^ result;
00016         LineCount++;
00017         
00018         //Try to read the line and throw exception if something wrong
00019         try { result=ReadingFile->ReadLine();}
00020         catch(Exception ^ e) {throw e;};
00021         return result;
00022 }

00024 /**
00025 * @brief Reads a line, split them to a number of fields which must be equal to FieldsNumber
00026 * and extracts the isotope and coordinates adding to the AtomCollection.
00027 * Can used for multiple frames, but the last frame of data is saved.
00028 * @param line String wih a line of the file.
00029 * @param Format Name of format in order to have it in the exception-error dialogs.
00030 * @param read_once Flag showing that atom data are read more than once.
00031 * @param AtomID Atom ID used when replacing an atom data, not during adding new atoms.
00032 * @param FieldsNumber Number of fields that supposinlgy this format have for the atoms
00033 * data. If not , an exception-errror will be thrown.
00034 * @param IsotopeIndex Zero-Index number which shows the field of the name of isotope.
00035 * @param AtomNumberIndex  Zero-Index number which shows the field of the atom number of isotope.
00036 * @param MassIndex  Zero-Index number which shows the field of the mass of isotope.
00037 * @param XIndex Zero-Index number which shows the field of X coordinate.
00038 * @param YIndex Zero-Index number which shows the field of Y coordinate.
00039 * @param ZIndex Zero-Index number which shows the field of Z coordinate.
00040 * @param factor A multiplying factor for the coordinates.
00041 * @param AtomCollection Collection where the data of the atom will be saved. 
00042 */
00043 void SpinachGUI::IOSpinSystem::ExtractIsotopeAndCoordinates(String ^ line, String ^ Format, bool read_once, int & AtomID,
00044                                                                   int FieldsNumber, int IsotopeIndex, int AtomNumberIndex, int MassIndex, int XIndex, int YIndex, int ZIndex,
00045                                                                   double factor, AtomsDictionary^% AtomCollection)
00046 {
00047         array<String^>^numbers = nullptr;   // Matrix of the fields after splitting of a line
00048         String^ delimStr = " ,";            //seperator of fields
00049         array<Char>^delimiter = delimStr->ToCharArray(); //Conversion to char array     
00050 
00051         //Split the line to a number of fields
00052         numbers = nullptr;
00053         numbers=line->Split(delimiter,StringSplitOptions::RemoveEmptyEntries );
00054 
00055         if(FieldsNumber==numbers->Length) 
00056         {
00057                 try {
00058                         Atom^ nAtom=gcnew Atom();
00059                         double x,y,z;
00060 
00061                         //Try to read coordinates
00062                         if (!Double::TryParse(numbers[XIndex], x) || !Double::TryParse(numbers[YIndex], y ) ||
00063                                 !Double::TryParse(numbers[ZIndex], z ))
00064                                 throw gcnew Exception("Error in Atom coordinates");
00065                         else 
00066                         {
00067                                 //Save the new atom and coordinates in the model
00068                                 nAtom->X=factor*x;nAtom->Y=factor*y;nAtom->Z=factor*z;
00069 
00070                                 //Can throw exception if does not find the isotope
00071                                 if(MassIndex==-1 && AtomNumberIndex==-1) 
00072                                         nAtom->isotope=Isotopes::FindIsotope(numbers[IsotopeIndex],0, 0);
00073                                 else if(MassIndex==-1) 
00074                                         nAtom->isotope=Isotopes::FindIsotope(numbers[IsotopeIndex],
00075                                          Convert::ToInt32(Convert::ToDouble(numbers[AtomNumberIndex])), 0);
00076                                 else if(AtomNumberIndex==-1) 
00077                                         nAtom->isotope=Isotopes::FindIsotope(numbers[IsotopeIndex],0,
00078                                          Convert::ToInt32(Convert::ToDouble(numbers[MassIndex])));
00079                                 else
00080                                         nAtom->isotope=Isotopes::FindIsotope(numbers[IsotopeIndex],
00081                                          Convert::ToInt32(Convert::ToDouble(numbers[AtomNumberIndex])), 
00082                                          Convert::ToInt32(Convert::ToDouble(numbers[MassIndex])));
00083 
00084 
00085                                 //If this is the first time reading this section(read_once==false)
00086                                 // just add it in the system else replace the previous frame value(if exists)
00087                                 if(read_once) 
00088                                         try{AtomCollection[AtomID]=nAtom; AtomID++;}
00089                                 catch(String ^ e)  {throw gcnew Exception("Problem in Elements: "+e);}
00090                                 else AtomCollection->Add(nAtom);
00091                         };
00092                 }
00093                 catch(Exception ^ e)
00094                 {       
00095                         //Wrong format of the field, where coordinates not giving number and where 
00096                         //isotope not giving valid isotope name
00097                         throw gcnew Exception("Problem in Reading "+Format+ " format in Line "+LineCount+":"+e->Message) ;
00098                 };
00099         }
00100         else
00101         {
00102                 //Wrong number of fields read
00103                 throw gcnew Exception("Problem in Reading Atom and Coordinates in Line "+LineCount+".") ;
00104         };
00105 
00106 
00107 }

00109 /**
00110 * @brief Reads three lines, split them to a number of fields which must be equal to FieldsNumber
00111 * (for each line) and extracts the interaction matrix creatting the interaction and 
00112 * adding to the InteractionCollection. Can used for multiple frames, but the last frame of data is saved.
00113 * @param line String of the first line(of three) that contains the matrix of the interaction.
00114 * @param InterName Name of interaction in order to have it in the exception-error dialogs.
00115 * @param A First atom of the interaction.
00116 * @param B Second atom of the interaction.
00117 * @param factor Multiplying factor for the elements of the matrix.
00118 * @param read_once Flag showing that atom data are read more than once.
00119 * @param startIndex Staring index of this kind of interaction. used when multiple frames.
00120 * @param InterID Interaction ID used when replacing an interaction data, not during adding new interaction.
00121 * @param FieldsNumber Number of fields that supposinlgy this format have for the interactions
00122 * data. If not , an exception-errror will be thrown.
00123 * @param M1Index Zero-Index number which shows the field of first element of the matrix.
00124 * @param M2Index Zero-Index number which shows the field of second element of the matrix.
00125 * @param M3Index Zero-Index number which shows the field of third element of the matrix.
00126 * @param unit Unit of the imported interaction matrix data.
00127 * @param IntKind Interaction kind of the imported interaction matrix data.
00128 * @param RefFrame Reference frame of the imported interaction matrix data.
00129 * @param InteractionCollection Collection where the data of the interaction will be saved. 
00130 */
00131 void SpinachGUI::IOSpinSystem::ExtractInteractionMatrix3x3(String ^ line, String ^ InterName, Atom^ A, Atom^ B, double factor,
00132                         bool read_once, int startIndex, int & InterID, int FieldsNumber, int M1Index, int M2Index, int M3Index, 
00133                         Unit ^ unit, InteractionKind IntKind, ReferenceFrame ^ RefFrame, InteractionsDictionary^% InteractionCollection)
00134 {
00135         array<String^>^numbers = nullptr;   // Matrix of the fields after splitting of a line
00136         String^ delimStr = " ,=";            //seperator of fields
00137         array<Char>^delimiter = delimStr->ToCharArray(); //Conversion to char array     
00138 	::Matrix3x3 ^matrix=gcnew ::Matrix3x3(); //3x3 matrix with the interaction
00139         double x,y,z;                       // For reading the tree element of the matrix
00140         double test;
00141 
00142 
00143         //               2.0010305    0.0002797    0.0000199
00144         //                          0.0001454    2.0020587    0.0000201
00145         //                              -0.0001453    0.0004632    2.0045716
00146         for(int j=0; j<3; j++)
00147         {
00148                 //The first line is already read, so do it only for hte next two
00149                 if(j>0) line=ReadLine() ;
00150 
00151                 //Sometimes the umber have "D" for double precision, so change it to E
00152             line=line->Replace('D','E');
00153 
00154                 //Split the line to a number of fields
00155                 numbers = nullptr;
00156                 numbers=line->Split(delimiter,StringSplitOptions::RemoveEmptyEntries );
00157 
00158                 //Try to read elements and save in the matrix
00159                 // use & not && to avoid short circuit
00160                 if (FieldsNumber!=numbers->Length & 
00161                         !Double::TryParse(numbers[M1Index], x) ||
00162                         !Double::TryParse(numbers[M2Index], y) ||
00163                         !Double::TryParse(numbers[M3Index], z))
00164                         throw gcnew Exception("Problem in Reading "+InterName+ " matrix elements in Line "+LineCount+". " +
00165                         "Either the number of fields in the line is incorrect or "+
00166                         "the format of fields(double) is incorrect.");
00167                 else {matrix[j*3+0]=factor*x;matrix[j*3+1]=factor*y;matrix[j*3+2]=factor*z; test=abs(x)+abs(y)+abs(z);};
00168         };
00169 
00170         //If Quadrupolar interactions smaller or equal than zero do not add;
00171         if(IntKind==InteractionKind::Quadrupolar && test<=0) return;
00172 
00173         //Try to create new Interaction
00174         Tensor^ nInteraction;
00175         try{
00176                 nInteraction=gcnew Tensor(A, B, IntKind, matrix);
00177                 nInteraction->unit=unit;
00178                 nInteraction->Frame=RefFrame;
00179         }//Throws when an invalid interaction is tried to create.
00180         catch(Exception ^ e)  
00181         { 
00182                 throw gcnew Exception("Problem in Reading Interaction: "+e->Message
00183                         +". Problem in Reading File in Line:"+getLineStop()+" .");
00184         }
00185         //If this is the first time reading this section(read_once==false)
00186         // just add it in the system else replace the previous frame value(if exists)
00187         if(read_once) 
00188                 try{InteractionCollection[InterID+startIndex]=nInteraction; InterID++;}
00189         catch(String ^ e)  {throw gcnew Exception("Problem in Elements: "+e);}
00190         else InteractionCollection->Add(nInteraction);
00191 
00192 };
